subject: Web3
title: DAOs vs. Traditional Companies
description: A quick win: understand DAOs vs. Traditional Companies.

hook.text: A company has a CEO, a board, and shareholders. A DAO has token holders, proposals, and smart contracts.

buildup.text: Companies make decisions top-down. DAOs make decisions through community votes where every token holder can participate.

discovery.text: DAOs operate transparently â€” treasuries are public, votes are on-chain, and rules are encoded in contracts.

twist.text: But DAOs move slowly. Voting takes days. Coordinating anonymous internet strangers is harder than managing employees.

climax.text: Companies are efficient but opaque. DAOs are transparent but chaotic. Neither model is perfect.

punchline.text: Companies have bosses. DAOs have votes. Both have politics.

quiz.question: What is a key difference between DAOs and traditional companies?
options: DAOs make decisions through community token-holder votes
